title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [11 december 1867]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [11 December 1867]
text: wensdayWednesday afternoonmy dear walti have got your letter with the 5 dollars and am obligeobliged to you Walter dear for the same Jeffy arrived here this morning just as i got up he left st louisSt. Louis sunday night he is very well and looks fat matty had got a place and went down yesterday afternoon she got it last week but they have staidstayed here all through the cold weather and you may be shuresure i have had a pretty busy time of it and yesterday afternoon they took up their quarters at their new abode but are back again to day so i aintain't had much grace they got all their things and carpets down before they went it is carlton aveCarlton Ave. between fulton aveFulton Ave. and green walking distance from here matty is very sorry she has taken the house as Jeff talks of her going to st louisSt. Louis i cant write much this time walter as i have to get tea against jeff and matt comes up from down town i liked your letter walt all but one thing and that was about your coming you didentdidn't say any thing about that dontdon't you think you can come Walt i doo so wish you can i know you will if you can get away) the weather is quite moderate now but we got through the cold quite well considering it was so cold matt could not stay next door so they moved in with me till yesterday i feel quite smart i am taking the medicine yet it makes me have a better appetite and i think helps me as a general thing i received mr OconorO'Connor's present with the letter and am very gratified to him and shall read it with much pleasure i make no doubt as the evening is so tedious as i cantcan't work much if i doodo my arm will pain me and i dontdon't have much to read now george is gone he used to get the papers i take the old eagleEagle mr OconorO'Connor is very kind in remembering me if he takes as much pleasure and i have reason to think he does in sending them as i doodo in reading them we are both well paid i have not heard from georgeGeorge since he went away but shall expect him home next week) good bie walter dear this is wrote in a hurry as the young ones is raising old ned Louisa Wh Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [11 December 1867]
